info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 13 at 1:59PM MDT until March 16 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches over mountain passes, with higher amounts above pass level. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph over mountain passes. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...East Glacier Park Region and Northwest Beaverhead County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from Midnight tonight to 9 AM MDT Tuesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Tuesday evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they are prepared for dangerous conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds combined with the heavy, wet nature of the snow could cause damage to power lines, and possibly cause a few power outages.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
